åŸæ–‡: PyCoder's Weekly - Issue #416

  • ç”¨ Python å’Œ OpenCV å¼€æºå·¥å…·å®ç°è™šæ‹ŸèƒŒæ™¯
    • BENJAMIN ELDER

With so much of the world stuck at home thanks to the COVID-19 pandemic, more and more workplaces are using video conferencing solutionsâ€”such as Zoomâ€”to bring work to your living room. Or kitchen. Or bedroom. Or bathroom. OKâ€¦ hopefully not that last one! Why not spice up your video conferencing with some awesome, homemade virtual backgrounds built with Python and OpenCV?

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

ç”¨ä¸€ä¸ªç®€å•ä¾‹å­æ¥æè¿°, å¼€æºä¸–ç•Œæœºæ¢°è§†è§‰æœ€å¸¸è§çš„åº”ç”¨...

)

    • REAL PYTHON
    • course

Learn about inheritance and composition in Python. Youâ€™ll improve your object-oriented programming (OOP) skills by understanding how to use inheritance and composition and how to leverage them in their design.

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

å¾ˆå¤š OOP æ¦‚å¿µéƒ½æ˜¯åœ¨ç‰¹æ®Šåœºæ™¯ä¸­æ‰æ„Ÿè§‰èˆ’æœçš„... ä½†æ˜¯,æˆ‘ä»¬å­¦ä¹ ä½¿ç”¨å´åè¿‡æ¥, å…ˆå°è¯•ç†è§£å„ç§æ¨¡å‹, å†å»æ’åœºæ™¯...

    • SEBASTIAN BUCZYÅƒSKI
    • opinion

â€œDo not use utils as a name for your Python module neither put it into a class name. Try to be more specific about the role of code â€“ e.g. create a place for validators, services or factories. If the role criterion doesnâ€™t help and you really dealing with utils, try grouping code by its theme.â€

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

utils å·²ç»å˜æˆåƒåœ¾ç®±äº†... æœ€å¥½ç»™å‡ºçœŸæ­£æœ‰æ„ä¹‰çš„æ¨¡å—å

)

  • ä»åˆ†å—åˆ°å¹¶è¡Œ: å€ŸåŠ© Dask åŠ é€Ÿ Pandas
    • ITAMAR TURNER-TRAURING

In a recent article, Itamar Turner-Trauring discussed how to read large datasets with Pandas using a chunking technique to reduce memory overhead. Chunking has another advantage: it enables parallelism, which can dramatically speed up processing time. Learn why and how to enable parallelism for your Pandas processing code using the Dask library.

  • æ•°æ®ç§‘å­¦: ç°å®ä¸ç¬¦åˆé¢„æœŸ
    • DAN FRIEDMAN
    • opinion

â€œSeven common ways a data science role may not meet your expectations through tens of data scientist interviews and anecdotes from popular media.â€ Also see the related discussion on Hacker News

  • å¦‚ä½•åœ¨ pytest ä¸­ä¸º Django æ¨¡å‹æä¾›æµ‹è¯•è£…ç½®
    • REAL PYTHON

In this step-by-step tutorial, youâ€™ll learn how to use fixtures to simplify your testing in pytest. If you use Django, pytest fixtures can help you write tests that are painless to update and maintain even as you make changes to your models.

  • PyPy 7.3.1 å‘å¸ƒ
    • PYPY BLOG

è®¨è®º

Discussions

  • å¯ä»¥ä»ä¸ç­‰é•¿çš„ç”Ÿæˆå™¨ä¸­æ£€ç´¢ zip() çš„é™é»˜æ¶ˆå…ƒå—?
    • STACK OVERFLOW

If you pass two generators to zip(), then the iterator returned by zip() stops whenever the shorter of the two generators runs out of values. If the generator passed to zip() in the first position is larger than the second, then there is an â€œextraâ€ value consumed from the larger generator. Why does this happen, and is it possible to retrieve the extra value consumed by zip()?

  • å¦‚ä½•ç®€åŒ–é‡å¤çš„ if / elif ?
    • STACK OVERFLOW

Comparing a single value against a number of conditions can result in long if/elif blocks. Is there a short and clean way to handle these comparisons?

    • REDDIT

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

å› ä¸ºç»ˆäºæœ‰èµ„é‡‘æ³¨å…¥äº†?

Articles, Tutorials and Talks

  • CuPy åœ¨ UPU ä¸ŠåŠ é€Ÿ NumPy ? å—¯å“¼? ç«Ÿç„¶å¾— Clojure!
    • DRAGAN DJURIC

NumPy is fast, but it doesnâ€™t play well with GPUs. For that, you can use CuPy, a drop-in NumPy replacement for GPUs developed by Nvidia. Now, what if I told you to crunch those numbers in Clojure on a GPU instead? Surely a language that compiles to Java couldnâ€™t beat C++ optimized for CUDA, could it? Dragan Djuric, author of Numerical Linear Algebra for Programmers compares CuPy and Clojure on a GPU, with some surprising results.

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

è§åˆ° Clojure å¾ˆæƒŠè®¶å˜›?

)

  • åœ¨ Python ä¸­æµ‹è¯• S3 çš„3ç§æ–¹æ³•
    • SANJAY SIDDHANTI

Testing an applicationâ€™s interaction with a third-party service can be difficult and frustrating. But sometimes a lot of business logic is wrapped up in those interactions, so testing them is important for building trust in the application. This article compares and contrasts three options for testing Amazon S3 integration using the pytest framework.

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

    • FEDERICO TOMASSETTI

Domain-specific languages (DSL) bring the power of high-level programming to domain experts (read: non-programmers). In this article, Federico Tomassetti walks you through the process of creating a DSL with the textX Python library. As a bonus, youâ€™ll also learn how to create syntax highlighting extension for VS Code that understands your language.

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

    • MICHAEL GALARNYK
    • â€¢ Shared by Michael Galarnyk

â€œDecision trees are a popular supervised learning method for a variety of reasons. Benefits of decision trees include that they can be used for both regression and classification, they donâ€™t require feature scaling, and they are relatively easy to interpret as you can visualize decision trees. This is not only a powerful way to understand your model, but also to communicate how your model works. Consequently, it would help to know how to make a visualization based on your model.â€

  • John Conway, ç”Ÿå‘½æ¸¸æˆçš„å‘æ˜è€…, æ­»äºCOVID-19
    • ARSTECHNICA.COM

John Horton Conway was one of the most influential mathematicians of the 20th and 21st centuries. His â€œGame of Lifeâ€ spawned countless implementationâ€”nearly becoming a rite of passage for programmers in any language. Sadly, the world lost this brilliant mind on April 11 due to complications from COVID-19. Renowned mathematician Terry Tao has also published a memoir in honor of John Conway on his blog.

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

å¤§å®¶éƒ½çŸ¥é“äº†, ç”Ÿå‘½æ¸¸æˆåˆ›å§‹äºº, å¯äººå®¶çœŸçš„ä¸æ˜¯ç”µå­æ¸¸æˆ... )

    • MATT GRIERSON

After reading an article about comparing a stock portfolio to the S&P 500, Matt Grierson wanted to go deeper and model a portfolioâ€™s performance by analyzing buys and sells from a CSV file and calculating the rate of return relative to an index across any specified timeframe. This turned out to be more involved than Matt first thought it would be! Fortunately, Matt decided to share his experienceâ€”and his solution.

    • GEORGE HO

George Ho proposed a change to PyMC4â€™s model specification API that he thought would help make the user experience more straightforward. Although those changes werenâ€™t ultimately accepted by his fellow PyMC4 core developers, the process led him into some interesting explorations into Pythonâ€™s abstract syntax tree.

An interview with Martin Breuss on getting started with Django, and how to learn Python through errors, and how errors really are your friends. Martin talks about his work with Coding Nomads, and teaching Python around the world. He also provides some tips on debugging and writing good questions.

entry.content:

ç¿»è¯‘ï¼šDustyposa

æ¥è‡ªèµåŠ©å•†ï¼ˆPSï¼šåŸæ–‡çš„èµåŠ©å•†ï¼‰: ä½¿ç”¨ Datadog ç›‘æ§ä½ çš„pythonæŒ‡æ ‡ï¼Œæ—¥å¿—ï¼Œé›†ç¾¤åˆ†æã€‚ä½¿ç”¨Datadogçš„åº”ç”¨åˆ†æï¼Œå¯ä»¥æ·±å…¥ä»»ä½•çº¬åº¦å¹¶ä¸”èƒ½æ‰¾åˆ°ä½ æ‰€éœ€è¦çš„ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œæ¥è¿›è¡ŒåŠ¨æ€è¯Šæ–­å’Œå¿«é€Ÿæ•…éšœæ’é™¤ã€‚é€šè¿‡å…è´¹çš„Datadog APMè¯•ç”¨ç‰ˆæ¥æé«˜åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºæ€§èƒ½ã€‚

æ–°é²œäº‹

å®£å¸ƒä¸€é¡¹æ–°çš„ Python Packaging èµåŠ©è®¡åˆ’

Python è½¯ä»¶åŸºé‡‘ä¼šçš„ Packaging å·¥ä½œç»„æ­£åœ¨å¯åŠ¨ä¸€ä¸ªå…¨æ–°çš„èµåŠ©è®¡åˆ’ï¼Œæ¥æ”¯æŒåŠæ”¹å–„ Python çš„ packaging ç”Ÿæ€ã€‚é€šè¿‡è¯¥è®¡åˆ’ç­¹é›†çš„èµ„é‡‘å°†ç›´æ¥ç”¨äºæå‡ä½ çš„å…¬å¸æ¯å¤©éƒ½åœ¨ä½¿ç”¨çš„å·¥å…·ï¼Œå¹¶ç»´æŒ Python Package Index çš„æŒç»­è¿è¥ã€‚é€šè¿‡è¿™ä¸ªè®¡åˆ’ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¸Œæœ›é‚£äº›ä¾èµ– Pythonã€å°è£…å·¥å…·ç”Ÿæ€ç³»ç»Ÿä»¥åŠ PyPI çš„å…¬å¸ï¼Œæ¥å¸®åŠ©æˆ‘ä»¬æ„å»ºä¸€ä¸ªç‰¢å›ºçš„åŸºç¡€ä»¥ç»§ç»­å·¥ä½œã€‚

EuroPython 2020: CFP for the Online Event

ç”±äºæˆ‘ä»¬ä¹‹å‰æ˜¯åœ¨ä¸¾åŠçº¿ä¸‹ä¼šè®®çš„å‰æä¸‹å¼€å§‹ä¸¾åŠäº† CFPï¼Œè€Œç°åœ¨æˆ‘ä»¬å§ EuroPython 2020 è½¬ä¸ºçº¿ä¸Šæ´»åŠ¨ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å°†æŠŠ CFP çš„æ—¶é—´å†å»¶é•¿ä¸¤å‘¨ï¼Œç›´åˆ° 4 æœˆ 12 æ—¥ï¼Œè®©æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªæƒ³å‚åŠ è¿™ä¸ªæ–°å½¢å¼æ´»åŠ¨çš„äººéƒ½æœ‰æœºä¼šæ¥æäº¤ä¼šè®®ææ¡ˆã€‚

æ–‡ç« ã€æ•™ç¨‹ä¸è¯é¢˜

100% å£°æ§ Halo ï¼ˆ9minï¼‰

å¦‚ä½•é€šè¿‡ä½ çš„éº¦å…‹é£æ¥æ§åˆ¶ä½ çš„é¼ æ ‡é”®ç›˜ï¼Œå®Œå…¨ç”±éŸ³é‡å’ŒéŸ³é«˜æ§åˆ¶ã€‚

ç”¨ Python NumPy è¿›è¡Œ Array Oriented Goodbye Plain, Old For-loops! Hello Numpy Arrays!

ä» PyTorch åˆ° PyTorch Lightning â€” ä¸€ä»½é¢å‘æ‰€æœ‰äººçš„ä»‹ç»
